component.name: OpenTelemetry Inspector
component.summary: Explore and debug OpenTelemetry logs, traces, and metrics

description.p: OpenTelemetry Inspector is a developer tool designed to capture, visualize, and debug OpenTelemetry data. It acts as a local OTLP receiver capable of handling logs, spans, and metrics.
Whether you are instrumenting a new microservice or troubleshooting distributed transactions, this tool provides a clear and immediate interface for your telemetry data.

ul.li: Monitor incoming HTTP (4318) and gRPC (4317) OTLP traffic.
Search and filter logs with structured data support.
Visualize distributed traces and span hierarchies.
Inspect metrics in real-time with automatic chart updates.

description.p: Perfect for local development where you need a quick way to verify that your instrumentation is working correctly without setting up a full observability stack like Prometheus, Jaeger, or Loki.

screenshot.caption: The main dashboard providing a summary of captured telemetry.
